subject: Re: using Java 2 SDK Version 1.5.0 Beta 2 with JUnit 3.8.1
msgSnippet: solved problem. output directory for compiler was not set properly. junit used the same (old) class files on every run. my fault. now it works! :) ... fails.

solved problem.
output directory for compiler was not set properly. junit used the
same (old) class files on every run. my fault.

now it works! :)

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "micha_fhtwberlin" <123micha@w...>
wrote:
> hi all!
> 
> was testing new Features of the Java 1.5 Beta2 release.
> (http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/relnotes/features.html)
> 
> Compiling with (new 1.5) compiler was done successfully.
> 
> But: JUnit attests an "Unresolved compilation problem" and test
fails.
> 
> does JUnit (3.8.1) use his own (old 1.4) compiler?
> and if yes, is there any chance to change/modify it?
> 
> thanks and regards,
> micha.
> 
> 
> ------------------
> 
> in detail:
> was trying to check the new box/unbox feature:
> 
> Object[] args= { "Mike", 33}; //1.5)
> instead of 
> Object[] args= { "Mike", new Integer(33)}; //(1.4)
> 
> JUnit quotes: "cannot convert from int to Object"
> which is reasonable for Version 1.4 but not for 1.5
